fields.description: This documentation [Viewing your system information|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRACloud/Viewing+your+system+information] says that a user with JIRA Administrators permission can access System Information. In Cloud this access is restricted to JIRA System Administrators.

When reviewing code in Stash, the files from the PR were listed in a separate sidebar that highlighted the files one had not looked at already (made them bold).  This UI made it easy to jump between files to review.  In Bitbucket Cloud, the list of files is listed near the top of the PR after any global comments.  One has to scroll through the whole PR or jump back up to this moving list to select specific files to go to.
fields.summary: Add file sidebar for bitbucket pull request

fields.description:
The ElasticSearch mapping in DevVM differs from the one in Production. 

The *mapping for Production*: [https://bitbucket.org/hipchat/ops/src/1bbb8b5f7a597923215e81415dfa4bcf4016f201/Elasticsearch/elasticsearch_private_template.json?at=master&fileviewer=file-view-default]

This is the *mapping in DevVM* (including the curl query to get it): [^mapping_on_devvm.log]

My guess is that the schema in DevVM is created dynamically, based on some input supplied by tests.

 

As a result of this schema inconsistency, I get an error when trying to view a 1-1 chat log. 

*The query URL is*: [http://localhost:9200/private-2017.04/document/_search]

*The query payload is*:
{code:java}
{"query":{"constant_score":{"filter":{"bool":{"must":[[{"term":{"from.group_id":1,"_cache":false}}],{"range":{"date.num":{"gte":"2017-04-20T21:00:00Z","lte":"2017-04-21T09:40:35Z"},"execution":"fielddata"}}],"should":[{"bool":{"must":[{"term":{"from.user_id":2,"_cache":false}},{"term":{"to.user_id":1,"_cache":false}}]}},{"bool":{"must":[{"term":{"from.user_id":1,"_cache":false}},{"term":{"to.user_id":2,"_cache":false}}]}}]}}}},"from":0,"sort":{"date.num":"asc"},"size":20}
{code}
*The query fails*: Parse Failure [No mapping found for [date.num] in order to sort on]

[^elasticsearch_failed.log]
fields.summary: ElasticSearch mapping in DevVM differs from the one in Production

fields.description:
*Current situation*

There is no easy way to see who changed what and when in a sprint. 

*Desired situation*

There should be an activity stream for a sprint. Where I am able to browse everything that was changed to a sprint since it was started. All status changes, new issues being added. Just like the profile activity stream, except that it is limited to all the activities that happen in the sprint.

Perhaps a lot of the functionality of the profile stream could be reused, except it should be filtered by sprint.

fields.summary: Dropdown is confusing and long here
Setting a particular  page with filters as your default browser page doens't work because after logging you in it goes tot he dashboard instead of the page you bookmarked

fields.description:
As a user I want to add / delete / update Acceptance criteria as an option field Check boxes while using JIRA Cloud but I am limited to use only Textbox or a checkbox field which is not editable and hence not fit for Acceptance criteria

 

Please provide a check box field that can be add / edit on ticket itself

this was the issue that i created [#JST-264089|http://mandrillapp.com/track/click/11828703/getsupport.atlassian.com?] initially

 

Refer screenshot for Acceptance criteria that we wanted
fields.summary: Acceptance criteria Check box items (editable on ticket) feature is required for Jira Cloud

fields.description:
Description:

In the Edge browser, depending on the options choosen, it's not possible to see the full timesheet. Zooming in or out “fixes” the issue – at least to the point where it’s a workaround – because then the top line becomes visible

Workaround:
* resolution\ resize\zoom it -  holding Crtl - or scroll down holding the Ctrl button
fields.summary: Can't see full timesheet in Edge browser
Hiding the list of projects from select users.

fields.description:
Almost every Web Application based products that have a <modifier>+Enter to submit the form uses the Mac Command Key.


For example, GMail, FreshDesk, Forums, GoogleSheets, etc.. Uses Command + enter to submit a form, but JIRA uses Ctrl.

 

I'd appreciate if could have a change in shortcuts align to MAC users. Ctrl is not so intuitive and user-friendly. 

 

Thanks

Some Customers request a feature that was available by JIRA Suite Utilities add-on that has not being enabled in Cloud Environment now ( no ETA to come back normally). We would appreciate if would be possible somehow store a history of assignees during transitions in order to know who was the owner of the ticket on a certain status.

When reorganizing several repositories, sometimes repositories need to be deleted. It can be hard to keep track of which repository settings page is open in each browser tab, and sometimes mistakes can be made that lead to accidentally deleting the wrong repository. If the user was forced to type the repository name before they can delete the repository (GitHub has this feature), then more accidental deletions could be avoided.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Cloud type repository name in delete confirmation dialog

fields.description: It is easy to create automatic backups of source code and wiki pages since they are git repositories, but there is currently no way to backup pull request/comment history. I recently accidentally deleted a repository, and I did not have any way to recover this lost history. For those who use pull requests for code review, it can be important to look back at pull request comments that occurred during code review.

Having to login with 2FA every day or so is a bit much. It'd be great to have a "Keep Me Logged In" option on the log in form.

It looks like this existed at some point: CLOUD-6159; was this a regression?
fields.summary: Add "Keep Me Logged In" option to id.atlassian.com/login

fields.description:
On id.atlassian.com, the single-field log in form's email field can be misinterpreted as a password field because many sites use this arrangement when they know a person's username and only need to request a password.

The issue is compounded by the no-label design: as soon as one types into the field, the placeholder label disappears.

The result is an autocomplete entry for the username field with my password.

I've been affected by this almost every login.
fields.summary: On id.atlassian.com, single-field log in form's email field can be misinterpreted as a password field

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Making an unauthenticated requests to a resource such as "secure/thumbnail/39513/screenshot-1.png" when not authenticated returns a 302 redirect with "cache-control:max-age=2419200" in the response header. This causes the resource to be cached as the "non-authenticated" version and will block access to authenticated requests from getting the resource properly.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Step 1) Browse to a resource like "secure/thumbnail/39513/screenshot-1.png" in an instance when not logged into that instance
# Step 2) log into the instance
# Step 3) Attempt to access the resource again

h3. Expected Results

Resource is displayed as if you were logged in from the start.

h3. Actual Results

The Cached version of the URL is returned from disk and an access denied page is given with the following error:
{quote}
You must log in to access this page. If you think this message is wrong, please contact your site administrators.
{quote}
even though you are already logged in.

h3.Workaround
Disable or clear the Cache in the browser.
fields.summary: unauthenticated requests to some assets cause cache to override authenticated requests to those resourses
install yii2 and setup to bitbucket

fields.description: Currently the filters for posting issues to channels are limited. In the previous version of the integration it was possible to define postings based on for example components.
fields.summary: Enhance @jirabot filter options when posting issues to channels

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

User needs support for said languages as the { code } tag has support for Java, XML and so on as per the [Text Formatting Help Page|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all].

h3. Suggested Solution

Implementing it if possible. User also said that CONFCLOUD-31813 reflects what is needed.

h3. Why this is important

User's needs to display the desired code correctly.
fields.summary: {code} tag to support CodeMacro and/or PowerShell

fields.description:
In JIRA Sofware, on Backlog Screen when right click and hit *Send to Top of Backlog* we are not able to create new issue through backlog screen. See the attachments for better understand.

 

It happens on Google Chrome and Firefox. Production and Test environment.
fields.summary: It's not possible to create a new issue unless if reload the page (top of backlog)

fields.description:
Once the customer receives the customer satisfaction email, they can click on the stars in the email to specify the level of satisfaction. Once the client is doing that, internet browser is opening and redirect the customer on the portal so he can write a feedback as the attachment.
There is a French question in there, the translation is not really accurate, I would like to change that line there… There is no place we can edit that.

 

According to customer feedback as suggestion would be something similar to:

 

"Merci d’avoir contribué à l’amélioration de nos façons de faire!

Si vous souhaitez partager des commentaires sur votre expérience avec nous, merci de les transmettre ici "

 

We'd appreciate if the team responsible for translations would take a look at this bug and analyse it deeper in order to solve it. Some Customers from Customers side are complaining it's not right

 

 

Follow attachment for better understand.
fields.summary: French translation for CSAT is not accurate.
to aid users navigation, it would help if their personal sidebar and/or personal links moved with them, regardless of the space they are in

fields.description:
!JIRA kanban dialog.jpeg|thumbnail! 

h3. Problem Definition

User wants said dialog pop up to not appear anymore after it shows up once. User doesn't want it to show up every time the column if full as it is causing problems to them such as clicking in one of the options of the pop up by mistake.

h3. Suggested Solution

Remove the pop up after uses sees it once or a set number of times.

h3. Why this is important

User doesn't want it to show up every time the column if full as it is causing problems to them such as clicking in one of the options of the pop up by mistake.
fields.summary: Disable the Kanban board "column full" popup from appearing again after showing up once

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Administration pages not showing access denied for users without administration permission

h3. Environment


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to {{<your_instance>.atlassian.net/admin/gsync}}
# Click on {{Users}}

h3. Expected Results
Everytime the user opens {{<your_instance>.atlassian.net/admin/users}} the message {{Access denied}} should be shown.
Also, the page {{<your_instance>.atlassian.net/admin/gsync}} should show {{Access denied}}.

h3. Actual Results
If the user opens {{Users}} from {{<your_instance>.atlassian.net/admin/gsync}} then the message below is shown:
{noformat}
An unknown error has occurred trying to contact our servers, please try again. If the issue persists please raise a ticket with support.
{noformat}

 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
fields.summary: Administration pages not showing access denied for users without administration permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary
{{Application Navigator}} not syncing between JIRA and Confluence. The issue is intermittent.

h3. Environment
* JIRA v1000.883.0
* Confluence 1000.1172.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a new link to {{Application Navigator}} on JIRA
# Open Confluence {{Application Navigator}} 

h3. Expected Results
The links on {{Application Navigator}} are synced between JIRA and Confluence

h3. Actual Results
The links are not added to both applications
 
h3. Notes
The issue is intermittent

h3. Workaround
Contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com] to clear the cache for your instance.
fields.summary: Application Navigator not syncing between JIRA and Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Application Navigator items are synced between JIRA and Confluence but the order of them is not copied

h3. Suggested Solution
Sync Application Navigator order between JIRA and Confluence	

h3. Why this is important
 
h3. Workaround 
(Optional)
fields.summary: Sync Application Navigator order between JIRA and Confluence

fields.description: In the JIRA Cloud for Slack integration, @jirabot will show details about an issue if it sees a URL to an issue ([https://jira.atlassian.net/browse/KEY-123)|https://jira.atlassian.net/browse/KEY-123).]   Is it possible for @jirabot to do the same when it sees this {{KEY-123}}?

In Slack, type `/jira issue-### comment "this is a comment"` to add comment to issue

You don't need to post the issue description every single time with your Slack integration
Построить дом

When employees leave Elsevier or a vendor, or simply move to new roles with changed responsibilities, they do not necessarily tell us they no longer need their JIRA logins.  They may not remember they have them.  Then, when we must deactivate a long-unused login, in order to add a user, we must browse through the entire list.

The ability to sort by last session would make this search much easier.
fields.summary: Add the Ability to Sort by Last Session to User Management

fields.description:
Hi, 

I want to get a report from Cloud. 

But I don't know  "how I can use Rest API"? 
I want to see our all issues history. 

Please help to me.

h3. Problem Definition

G suite integration has a feature to delete user or change user's information automatically every 4 hours.
 cf. [Manage users with group-based syncing|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-users-with-group-based-syncing-744721645.html]

However both of Confluence and JIRA have audit log, they only show general information but not any detailed log.
 Hence currently admin even cannot know that the user was deleted/changed by G Suite integration.

!Screenshot_2017-03-28_17_11_34.png|thumbnail!

 
h3. Suggested Solution

Show that the manipulation was executed by G Suite integration, preferably with detailed log such as "The user is deactivated on G suite" message.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Fine-grained audit log corresponding to G Suite account manipulation

fields.description:
It is already possible to connect JIRA Cloud with Github, some users would also like to have the option to add Gitlab.

For reference, [Connect JIRA Cloud to Github|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/connect-jira-cloud-to-github-814188429.html].

fields.summary: Easy way to view what projects and Spaces an user belongs to.

fields.description: Some customers would want to have an easier way to list which projects and spaces the system users belong without go into the project and space.
fields.summary: Easy way to view what projects and Spaces an user belongs to.

fields.description: Your pricing section has a minor typo. It says 2,0000 which is far too many numbers to be two thousand.

Has your standard changed over the past year regarding SPF?  We need to enable SPF for our assigned xyz.Atlassian.net domain.  Your ticket closed last year: CLOUD-5377 suggests that you were not working on SPF at all because DKIM had been enabled instead.

fields.summary: As Nancy, I want to see the property analytics page so that I will know how popular are my properties

fields.description:
Hello everyone!

We have a feature request from one of our customers:

Ability to add watchers directly to a Sprint.

The reason is not to be necessary to add the watchers list to each and every ticket under the Sprint manually.

For that, looking for a way to add the watchers to the Sprint and all the tickets under that sprint should have those watchers and an email notification has to reach the watchers.

Changes such as the introduction of Media API to manage attachments may break existing customer scripts, mess with the Firewall whitelists, etc. (Media API for example, will fire a separate request to https://media-api.atlassian.io ). We should manage this better and notify customers earlier on any such changes before the day of rollout.
fields.summary: Notification to customers on important changes to Cloud

fields.description:
h3. "User Sessions" option not available anymore, for both JIRA Admins and Sysadmins. [Documentation here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/monitor-a-user-s-activity-794198946.html] says it should be available for JIRA Administrators, but we checked on more than one instance and it is not available.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Try go to System > User Sessions (under Security) and access this option

h3. Expected Results

Being able to see the User Sessions option and accessing it

h3. Actual Results

The option is not available anymore. No newsletter or blog post seems to have been made regarding this change.

h3.Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: "User Sessions" option not available anymore, for both JIRA Admins and Sysadmins

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users in China can't use User Management features 
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
 * JIRA v1000.621.5

 * Confluence v1000.722.3

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1: Login to instance with network in China

 # Step 2: Attempt to access User Management

 
h3. Expected Results

User Management working as intended

 
h3. Actual Results

China firewall preventing Google Assets from loading, preventing User Management from working

 
h3. Workaround

Utilize a VPN to bypass the Google restrictions
fields.summary: Users in China can't use User Management features

fields.description:
Hi All,

We are having an issue related to syntax helper documentation returning 404. Always when we open the syntax helper as in screenshot, all pages I have accessed I'm facing this behavior, can anyone apply some fix? There're some customer reporting errors related to it.

Steps to reproduce:
 - Try comment (you can test it even through sac.atlassian.com).
 - Click on Comment.
 - Select the button (?) (Get local help about wiki markup help ).
 - Click on ALL
 - Find for Docs in Creates a download link section.
 - Click in Docs. Link called: [https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/$extLink]
 - Returns 404.

Find Screenshot below for further details.

 

 

I think it should be redirected to [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira061/jira-administrators-faq/usage-faq/linking-to-local-file-under-firefox].
fields.summary: Documentation is broken for syntax helper

fields.description:

Information for JQL for linkedIssue is not updated for below documentation on *Advanced searching - functions reference*

https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-functions-reference-764478342.html#Advancedsearching-functionsreference-linkedIssuelinkedIssue
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Go to Advanced search in issue navigator and start typing linkedIssue in the search box
h3. Expected Results

Result in advance search box should show *linkedIssue*
h3. Actual Results

No *linkedIssue* showing from the search box

fields.summary: juguhk jguk kijl vgfgv nbg kjdjknd kjowurndk kwn

fields.description:
At the moment, when we try to create a single user, we can enter the Full Name of the user.

However, when we try to *Bulk Create* users, we are only allowed to enter the email address and the username will be taken from the email address.

h3. Suggestion

Please add the ability to configure name when Bulk Create users.
fields.summary: Add Full Name When Bulk Create Users

fields.description:
When the instance uses the Atlassian ID, after you log in with one Atlassian ID, you can't open another session, in the same browser, with a second Atlassian ID.

That is useful to the customer to be able to log in using different users (a Customer and an Admin, for instance).
h2.  
 Workaround:

Log in another window in incognito mode.
fields.summary: Multiple sessions in the same browser using the Atlassian ID
Backup Import Other Jira Cloud Instance
